intro: Xanthorrhoea fulva, commonly known as the yellow grass tree, is a unique flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the genus Xanthorrhoea, which is characterized by its tall, grass-like foliage and a distinctive, woody, bottle-shaped stem. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers in dense spikes, typically emerging from the base of the stem. Xanthorrhoea fulva is adapted to arid environments, with deep root systems that allow it to survive in dry conditions. It plays an important ecological role in its habitat, providing food and shelter for various native animals.
